question: 黒潮
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>black</kanji> <kanji>tide</kanji> isn't what you think, most likely. This is the <vocabulary>Japan current</vocabulary>, aka the <vocabulary>Kuroshio Current</vocabulary>. It's a Northern flowing  current on the West side of the Pacific Ocean. Have you heard of the Gulf Stream? It's kind of like that.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading is the kun'yomi readings of the two kanji, put together. <ja>黒</ja> and <ja>潮</ja>.
